Description: Tag found on the left wing of the grouse. Letter corresponds to colour of tag, number corresponds to unique numerical identifier. Within leks, no two grouse should have the same colour combination. Colours: G = green, R = red, Y = yellow, W = white, O = orange, B = blue. May also be found in combination with each other on tags.

Tag found on the right wing of the grouse. Letter corresponds to colour of tag, number corresponds to unique numerical identifier. Within leks, no two grouse should have the same colour combination. Colours: G = green, R = red, Y = yellow, W = white, O = orange, B = blue. May also be found in combination with each other on tags.
Notes: Questions for Pat - why are some only labelled with colour and not number?

Description: Lek in which individual was observed strutting.
Age of grouse; either juvenile, or adult.
Notes: Questions for Pat - what age ranges do the ages correspond to?

Description: Number of struts performed by individual in 5 minutes.

Values and units: Time quantified as proportion of 24-hour day, numeric
Description: Amount of time spent on each strut.

Values and units: Time quantified as proportion of 24-hour day, numeric
Description: Time of sunrise on day of strut.

Values and units: Time quantified as proportion of 24-hour day, numeric
Description: Amount of time elapsed before or after sunrise when individual began to strut.
Notes: Questions for Pat - began strutting? Is this what this means?

Description: Distance strutting cock was away from hens. 0 = no hens on lek, 1 = 0-5 meters, 2 = 5 - 10 meters, 3 = >10 meters, 4 = unknown.
Indicates whether individual bred when observed. 0 = did not breed, 1 = bred, 3 = unknown,.
Notes: Is it whether they bred, or whether they are a breeding male? Some inconsistencies in raw data from 1990 where non-breeding individuals were assigned a value of NA rather than zero. After checking with data owner and associated data, a value of 0 (did not breed) was assigned to individuals originally assigned NA.

Description: Indicates whether individual had avian malaria. 0 = with malaria, 1 = without malaria, 3 = unknown, NA = data missing.
Notes: A value of 3 indicates individual was sampled for malaria and status was unclear, while a value of NA indicates individual was not sampled. Not all individuals were sampled.

Description: Indicates whether individual had lice. 0 = lice absent, 1 = lice present, 3 = unknown, NA = data missing.
Notes: A value of 3 indicates individual was sampled for lice and status was unclear, while a value of NA indicates individual was not sampled. Not all individuals were sampled.
